timeline.bodyText:
Just a note, this means that we need to use the RealmAwareZkClientConfig to generate HelixZkClient.ZkConnectionConfig.
HelixZkClient.ZkConnectionConfig is pair {zkServerAddress, sessiontimeout} .
zkServerAddress can be derived from shardingKey in RealAwareZkClientConfig. However, sessiontimout can not.
So here, shall we  do:
1/ add sessiontimeout to  RealmAwareZkClientConfig?
or
2/ having another parameter to specify a sessiontimeout to the interface method buildZkClient?

Another high level question, in the scope of dedicatedZkClient or sharedZkClient discussion, all the create ZkClient already are RealAware, right? we don't really need to have a mode for user to specify.
The mode can be kept internally for the client to know. In fact, even this (internally keep the type) may not be needed as we have new dedicatedZkClient and new sharedZkClient which wraps sharedZkClient and zkclient as of now. The type information is already encode in the class design. The beauty of OO inheritance.
replies.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText:
@kaisun2000

Yes, we should add the sessionTimeout field to this. I will add it for completeness (this was a draft, so I just wanted to first give you an idea). :)
Yes and no.


RealmAwareZkClients produced by RealmAwareZkClientFactory are all single-realm mode. So yes, mode might not be required as a method parameter for buildZkClient().
We should still keep this field internally because not all RealmAwareZkClients are single-realm mode. For example, if you create a FederatedZkClient instance, it should still have a mode = MULTI_REALM.
So yes, let's follow your suggestion to remove the mode parameter from here, but we should keep it as an internal variable that we could expose to the user (for instance, RealmAwareZkClient should support an interface method like getMode() that returns either SINGLE_REALM or MULTI_REALM)

@kaisun2000
I tried that but that is going to break backward-compatibility because of different return types in the setter methods.
To illustrate:
public ZkClientConfig setZkSerializer(PathBasedZkSerializer zkSerializer) is what we have in HelixZkClient. But if this class extended RealmAwareZkClientConfig, then it will be returning an instance of RealmAwareZkClientConfig, which would break the existing methods in Shared and DedicatedZkClientFactories.
